meanings.definition: The outer edge or border of a land or area.
meanings.sent1: The travelers set up camp at the rimlands of the forest.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse stood tall on the rimlands overlooking the sea.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the rimlands threw a party for the explorers.
meanings.sent4: The rimlands of the desert whispered secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers bloomed along the rimlands, creating a beautiful border.

meanings.definition: The coastal areas surrounding a larger landmass.
meanings.sent1: Fishermen sailed their boats in the rimlands, hoping for a big catch.
meanings.sent2: The birds flocked to the rimlands, enjoying the ocean breeze.
meanings.sent3: The children built sandcastles in the rimlands, imagining kingdoms by the sea.
meanings.sent4: The rimlands embraced the waves, dancing with the tides.
meanings.sent5: The sunsets in the rimlands painted the sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A region or area on the periphery of a larger territory.
meanings.sent1: The small village thrived in the rimlands, away from the bustling city.
meanings.sent2: Explorers ventured into the rimlands, seeking hidden treasures.
